channel.title: Black Mesa is no longer a mod
channel.description: I think we can all say, Black Mesa has had so many changes in the most amazing ways, thats it's insulting to call it a mod. Its standalone game practically. I mean, if you get a mop (half life 2) and replace parts on it bit by bit (Black Mesa) in the end, is it the same mop? No. Black mesa can be safely called a game rather than a mod in my opinion. Post below to say what you think.

item.title: Black Mesa is no longer a mod
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
BM is technically a mod, but it’s comparable in scope and content to a brand new game, I think we can all agree.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is no longer a mod
item.dc:creator: MR.sugar
item.description:
higgsboson:

I agree with the OP. Black Mesa is not a mod, it’s a mop. For this reason, it goes into your “SourceMops” folder.

Also, there was a new update. Check out their profile at mopdb.com!

Also, I heard Valve is workin on new mopping tools!

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa is no longer a mod
item.dc:creator: Slowpokes_Bro
item.description:
and also

This is a mod whether you like it or not. As the previous posters have said, it’s called a total-conversion mod. Please do your research before posting. If you had, then you would not be in the awkward position of having said something that is below-average intelligence.
